newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish debt yields fall, crown strong.
newsitem.headline: Swedish debt yields fall, crown strong.

text.p: Swedish debt yields fell sharply in early trade, spurred by yesterday's gains in U.S. Treasuries. The crown tailed a stonger dollar and advanced further against the mark.
"We are all joining the rally after the Greenspan report to the congress", said one dealer.
But the crown also benefitted from an upbeat report from Sweden's National Economic Research Institute, indicating strength in both Swedish export industry and the domestic market.
"This will lead to growing flows from Swedish export companies wanting to exchange income to crowns", said one dealer.
At 0930 GMT, ten-year bond yields were down nine basis points to 6.41 percent while six-month T-bills were down two basis points at 6.41 percent.

The mark slipped to 4.2820/50 crowns from 4.3030/60 crowns yesterday afternoon. The market is looing at the National Debt Office's auction of ten billion crowns in T-bills and further moves in the U.S. market this afternoon.
